decision_conditions: Given the substantial size of the existing and proposed bedrooms which could result in double occupancy, the existing and proposed HMO would not constitute a small HMO (Class C4) as defined by the The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended). The existing and proposed HMO would constitute a large HMO (Sui Generis) that would not benefit from permitted development rights set out under the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). The development would not be lawful and the application is refused.
description: Conversion of roof space to habitable use to include a rear dormer, conversion of roof from hip to gable end and removal of chimney stack (Application for a Certificate of Lawful Development for a Proposed Development)
